page.title: 06BUSES WEST OF THE EXE.
page.content: Exeter is the first place in Britain to try out a minibus system. There are 15 minibuses on the St.Thomas route the first bus starts at 6.20am and the last bus finishes at 23.40pm. A minibus can be hailed at any place that is not dangerous except in the city centre. Minibuses run at 10 minute intervals and can seat 16 people with 3 standing. The double decker buses have 74 seats and allow 8 people standing.The first bus starts at 5.05 and the last bus runs at 23.40. There are two bus stops in Fore Steet. These buses cross the River Exe: G,J,M,B,C,D,P, 359,360,361 and the minibuses. The average life of a bus is 15 years. Buses are not normally scrapped, they are bought by other companys or put to another use such as playbuses.
